battleship

Class BattleButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • battleship.BattleButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class BattleButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
    Class the extends JButton, used as the individual squares for the boards.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Parker
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isHasShip

        public boolean isHasShip()
        If a ship has been placed on the button.
        Returns:
        True if the button has a ship, False if not

      • setHasShip

        public void setHasShip(boolean hasShip)
        Used when a ship has been placed, or for future features if a ship was removed from a square.
        Parameters:
        hasShip - True is a ship was placed, False if not

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit()
        If the button was guessed and it was a hit.
        Returns:
        True if it was hit, false if not

      • setHit

        public void setHit(boolean hit)
        Set the hit boolean. Disables and colors the button red if it is true.
        Parameters:
        hit - if the ship was hit

      • isMiss

        public boolean isMiss()
        If the button was guessed and it was a miss.
        Returns:
        True if it was missed, false if not

      • setMiss

        public void setMiss(boolean miss)
        Set the miss boolean. Disables and colors the button white if it is true.
        Parameters:
        miss - if the shot was missed

      • setShip

        public void setShip(Ship ship)
        Set the ship that has been placed on the button.
        Parameters:
        ship - type that has been placed

      • getShip

        public Ship getShip()
        Get the ship placed on this button.
        Returns:
        the ship placed or null if none

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns if a square has been hit or missed. Used by OppBoard class to prevent double selections.
        Returns:
        True if the square hasnt been guessed, false if not.

      • revertColor

        public void revertColor()
        Reverts a buttons color to usual. Used after a button has been highlighted after selection.
